title: General Electric will pay $200 million to settle claims it misled investors.
summary: By Gillian Friedman

title: ‘Is Exxon a Survivor?’ The Oil Giant Is at a Crossroads.
summary: Exxon Mobil is struggling to find its footing as demand for oil and gas falls and world leaders and businesses pledge to fight climate change.

title: For Biden’s Economic Team, an Early Focus on Climate
summary: In announcing key economic advisers in the White House and the cabinet, the president-elect has emphasized action to boost clean energy and reduce emissions

title: Biden Faces Challenge as Congress Drops State Aid to Secure Stimulus
summary: A campaign by conservative activists and disputes over how to divvy up federal assistance have thwarted negotiators. But President-elect Joe Biden will make a new push for such funding next year.

title: Stocks are roiled as a fast-spreading virus strain in Britain overshadows the stimulus deal.
summary: By Eshe Nelson and Matt Phillips

title: A Race to Become the Tesla of Delivery Trucks and Vans
summary: Investors are betting that small companies like Workhorse will help popularize electric commercial vehicles. And Tesla aims to extend its reach.

title: The Year the Fed Changed Forever
summary: Jerome H. Powell’s central bank slashed rates, bought bonds in huge sums and rolled out never-before-tried loan programs that shifted its identity. The backlash is already beginning.

title: The Place Hit Hardest by the Virus
summary: The coronavirus has disfigured Gallup, a small New Mexico town near Native American reservations that is now one of the hardest hit places in the country.

title: Look but Don’t Touch: Supercars That Have Barely Been Driven
summary: The power and prestige of cars like a 1990 Lamborghini might compel some owners to take a Sunday drive. But with odometers this low, the investment would take a hit.

title: A Monster Wind Turbine Is Upending an Industry
summary: G.E.’s giant machine, which can light up a small town, is stoking a renewable-energy arms race.

title: Wall Street Eyes Billions in the Colorado’s Water
summary: Investor interest in the river could redefine century-old rules for who controls one of the most valuable economic resources in the United States.

title: ‘A Slap in the Face’: The Pandemic Disrupts Young Oil Careers
summary: Students and recent graduates struggle to get hired as the oil industry cuts tens of thousands of jobs, some of which may never come back.

title: Saudi Arabia Will Cut Its Oil Production, Allowing Russia’s to Grow
summary: Oil prices rose to levels not seen since February. The two major oil producers had been moving in lock step since an April agreement to cut output.

title: Stocks Hold Gains Amid Violence at the Capitol
summary: The early gains came as investors bet that Senate victories by Democrats would lead to a surge in federal spending. Analysts said that premise didn’t change even as a mob engulfed the Capitol.

title: E.U. Agrees to Slash Carbon Emissions by 2030
summary: The agreement calls for European Union countries to cut their collective greenhouse gas emissions by 55 percent from 1990 levels, a more substantial reduction than previously proposed.

title: U.K. to Halt Subsidies for Fossil Fuel Projects Abroad
summary: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has been positioning himself as a leader in fighting global warming, an area where he can make common cause with President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: In Landmark Ruling, Air Pollution Recorded as a Cause of Death for British Girl
summary: Legal and environmental experts hailed a coroner’s ruling that, for the first time in Britain, directly linked a specific person’s death to air pollution.

title: Norway’s Supreme Court Makes Way for More Arctic Drilling
summary: The top court ruled against environmental groups Tuesday, saying the right to a clean environment did not bar the government from drilling for offshore oil.

title: Influencers May Face Fines as China Tackles Obesity and Food Waste
summary: According to a new government report, more than half of the country’s adult population is either overweight or obese. Chinese officials have vowed to address the problem with a campaign.

title: Refugees Come Under Fire as Old Foes Fight in Concert in Ethiopia
summary: Forces from neighboring Eritrea have joined the war in northern Ethiopia, and have rampaged through refugee camps committing human rights violations, officials and witnesses say.

title: Iraq, Struggling to Pay Debts and Salaries, Plunges Into Economic Crisis
summary: Oil-rich Iraq, its economy hobbled by neglect and corruption, has devalued its currency and had its imported electricity cut off for nonpayment.

title: Gulf States Agree to End Isolation of Qatar
summary: Gulf leaders saw the agreement, which ends a three-year blockade of Qatar, as a gift to President Trump and preparation for President Biden.

title: Guerrilla Leader, Drug Baron, Gold Magnate … and Now Social Reformer?
summary: Suriname’s vice president, Ronnie Brunswijk, has been many things. Now, he wants to be known as the man who will spread the country’s newfound oil wealth equitably.

title: In the Cold and Rain, India’s Farmers Press Their Stand Against Modi
summary: Protesters have created camps around Delhi that are virtual cities unto themselves, using donations and their own organizational skills to help their battle against new government farm policies.
